paper_abstract: A set S of vertices in a graph G is a paired-dominating set of G if every vertex of G is adjacent to some vertex in S and if the subgraph induced by S contains a perfect matching. The maximum cardinality of a minimal paired-dominating set of G is the upper paired-domination number of G, denoted by I"(pr)(G). We establish bounds on I"(pr)(G) for connected claw-free graphs G in terms of the number n of vertices in G with given minimum degree delta. All these bounds are sharp.
